meanings.definition: To sign (a document already signed by another) in order to validate or confirm it.
meanings.sent1: I had to countersign the contract after my boss signed it first.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer asked me to countersign the agreement to make it official.
meanings.sent3: I felt like a detective when I had to countersign the secret message.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the countersign that everything was going to be okay.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's countersign on my test paper made me proud of my hard work.

meanings.definition: A signature added to a document already signed by another, in order to validate or confirm it.
meanings.sent1: The countersign on the will indicated it was legally binding.
meanings.sent2: Please provide your countersign on the form for authentication.
meanings.sent3: The cat's paw print served as a cute countersign on the adoption papers.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was the countersign of approval from the audience.
meanings.sent5: The golden seal acted as the official countersign of the royal decree.
